video.title: Google Interview Question: How to Code a Queue Using a Stack. Whiteboard Wednesday by Irfan Baqui
video.description:
Irfan Baqui shows you how to approach whiteboard coding interviews in this weekly series of Whiteboard Wednesday!

Check out more Whiteboard Wednesday videos here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=71kEvXsEKYQ&list=PLs2vRLhtciEt46Fg-uz1LQxb4xSW-KMGa

Today's question is from Google: "How to implement a queue using stacks?"

About Irfan: Irfan Baqui is a software engineer based in San Francisco. He loves to help other engineers grow and writes about how you can get your dream job: irfanbaqui.com/blog
You can learn more about Irfan here: http://irfanbaqui.com/about

Irfan publishes weekly tech and non-tech videos on his youtube channel, including Whiteboard Wednesdays. Check it out and subscribe! https://youtube.com/c/irfanbaqui

Ask Irfan a question or just say Hi: https://twitter.com/irfanbaqui

-

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Dev P
topLevelComment.text:
Hello Irfan,
So we are using recursive approach here, and under the hood recursion uses Stack. If we go through iteratively, then we have to have an array.
So ultimately I'm using one another data structure here.
So can I ask it to interviewer like what is the point to do this whole stuff when I can easily do it??

topLevelComment.author: Rahul Gupta
topLevelComment.text: wonderful video.. would love to watch more like these.

replies.author: Irfan Baqui
replies.text:
Rahul Gupta There are more on my channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/irfanbaqui 
I'll be posting new ones every week, so make sure to subscribe :)

topLevelComment.author: David Castelblanco Benavides
topLevelComment.text: I really like the recursion that Irfan used while implementing the solution, I'd come up with a cycle that pops and pushes the elements until it reaches the first element.

topLevelComment.author: Radio Heaven Tamil
topLevelComment.text: Letters in the board are too small.. Pls improve it in next video..

topLevelComment.author: Dimko Zhluktenko
topLevelComment.text: I haven't ever thought about implementing queue with stack, but it's possible however. Thanks

replies.author: Irfan Baqui
replies.text: You'd almost never do this in real life.. but a good one to solve.

topLevelComment.author: Irfan Baqui
topLevelComment.text:
What kind of problems should I solve next? Also, there are more on my YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/irfanbaqui
New ones every week, so make sure to subscribe :)

replies.author: Manoj
replies.text: Irfan Baqui Please could you make a video based on data file handling. A problem that is to  create a program for storing and searching data's of school children's according to their roll number. This video was really awesome. Thank you . Hope to see more.

replies.author: Sahil Mangotra
replies.text: Can you please implement top view of a tree without hash map  in java or c++ (Implementing in c)?

topLevelComment.author: Interview_DS_Algo
topLevelComment.text: Thanks a lot . It was really helpful
